p: Oleanolic acid is largely present in the plant kingdom, with over 120 species serving as natural sources [ 17]. The cicatrizing effect was highlighted in a research performing a bioactivity guided fractionation of a plant used in traditional Peruvian medicine, Anredera diffusa (Moq.) Sperling (Basellaceae). The authors documented the accelerated closure of wound and enhanced tensile strength on an excision wound model [ 84].
